member.name: P:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ContentPosition.ReferenceElementCharOffset
member.summary: The character offset when the is a element. The value represents the character index from the text start when equals , and character index from the text end when equals . This property can have value of '-1' which is only permitted when is of type , and means that the position is not inside the element. This value is also only permitted and makes sense for positions that represent an Outgside-Range Element Boundary. See for more details.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ContentRange
member.summary: Represents a contiguous area in a document between two s.
member.documentation: Range and positions act as boundaries, whereas a boundary can be of a different kind: 1) Story Boundary: story-start and story-end are used as a boundaries. 2) Inbound Boundary: Elements inside a are used as boundaries. 3) Outbound Boundary: Elements that are out side of a and adjecent to the first/last elements in the range are used as boundaries. Outbound boundaries Are very important because a range that is completely empty cannot be represented by In bound Boundaries.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ContentRange.GetSimplifiedRangeBoundaries(Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Element@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@,Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Element@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Translates the Start/End positions of this to element-based absolute positions. This means that the range boundaries are translated/simplified into boudaries represented by the first and the last element in the range, and all character offsets are normal string indexes. Returns 'False' if the range is empty. This method is only used to calculate simplified boundary positions that can be used by different operations.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ContentRange.TranslateRangeBoundariesToOutboundRangeBoundaries
member.summary: This method translates the range's start and stop positions (could be Inbound Range Boundaries) into Outbound Range Boundaries. We need to do this when the result of a operation (e.g. Delete) will result in a removal of start and stop position reference elements (which would corrupt the ). Outbound Range Boundaries reference elements that are outside of a .

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ContentRange.SplitStartAndEndTextElementsAccordingToRangeBoundaries
member.summary: If the range starts and/or ends with Text elements and the character offsets are not '0', this metod splits the two Text elements in order to get rid of the character offsets. Returns False if the range is empty.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ContentRange.OnTextElementHasSplit(System.Object,Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TextElementSplitEventArgs)
member.summary: The will by calling this method notify this that the an somewhere in the DOM tree has split. The range can use this notification to see if the boundary elements need to be fixed (e.g. extended to the newly created element).

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ContentRange.TextFinder.OnTextElementSplit(System.Object,Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TextElementSplitEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called whenever a element gets split. When this happens we need to check if this changes the current segment position ( and ). If so, we need to reset the current segment search, calculate the new segment start position ( and ), and then rebuild and start with a new search in the rebuilt segment.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ContentRange.TextFinder.OnElementRemoved(System.Object,Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ElementRemovedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called whenever an gets deleted from the DOM tree. When this happens we need to check if this changes the current segment position ( and ). If so, we need to reset the current segment search, calculate the new segment start position ( and ), and then rebuild and start with a new search in the rebuilt segment.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Paragraph.GetPreviousParagraphInKeepWithNextChainCandidate
member.summary: Returns the previous Paragraph that is in the KeepWithNext chain of the given Paragraph. The returned Paragraph is only a KWN chain candidate. The KeepWithNext format property of the returned Paragraph will determine whether it is indeed the KWN Paragraph of the given Paragraph. Note that a KWN chain only determines a sequence of Paragraphs that could be sticking to their next paragraphs if their KeepWithNext format properties are set to True.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows which shall comprise each a table style row band for this table style. This element determines how many rows constitute each of the row bands for the current table, allowing row band formatting to be applied to groups of rows (rather than just single alternating rows) when the table is formatted.

member.name: P:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Tables.TableFormat.ColumnBandSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns which shall comprise each a table style column band for this table style. This element determines how many columns constitute each of the column bands for the current table, allowing column band formatting to be applied to groups of columns (rather than just single alternating columns) when the table is formatted.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiter
member.summary: Specifies a delimiter between the existing target document content and the imported document content.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiter.None
member.summary: The imported document content will simply be appended to the end of the existing target document content and no page break or section break will be added to delimit the existing and the imported content.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiter.PageBreak
member.summary: A page break will be added before the imported document content will be added to the existing target document content. As a result, the imported document content will start on a new page in the target (merged) document.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiter.ColumnBreak
member.summary: A text column break will be added before the imported document content will be added to the existing target document content. As a result, the imported document content will start on a new column in the target (merged) document.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiter.SourceDocumentStartingSection
member.summary: A section break with the starting of the source document will be added before the imported document content will be appended at the end of the existing target document content. As a result, the imported document content will start in a new section in the target (merged) document.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiter.TargetDocumentInsertionPointSection
member.summary: A section break with the starting of the source document will be added before the imported document content will be added to the existing target document content. As a result, the imported document content will start in a new section in the target (merged) document.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiterSectionStart
member.summary: Specifies the value for the section that delimits the appending/source and the target document.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiterSectionStart.OriginalSectionSetting
member.summary: The original of the used delimiter section will be used.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiterSectionStart.ForceNewPage
member.summary: Section will start on the new page, regardless of the original setting.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiterSectionStart.ForceContinuous
member.summary: Section will start on the same page where the previous section ends, regardless of the original setting.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiterSectionStart.ForceEvenPage
member.summary: Section will start on the even-numbered page, regardless of the original setting.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentDelimiterSectionStart.ForceOddPage
member.summary: Section will start on the odd-numbered page, regardless of the original setting.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentPageNumbering
member.summary: Specifies what shall be the starting page number for the imported document. This value is only applicable when setting the to a value other than 'None'.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentPageNumbering.OriginalSectionSetting
member.summary: The original of the used section will be used. The section used is either taken from the source document or target document.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentPageNumbering.ForceRestart
member.summary: The imported document page numbers will be restared with the starting number '1'.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportedDocumentPageNumbering.ForceContinuation
member.summary: The imported document page numbers will continue from the highest number of thge previous section of the target element.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportStyleMode
member.summary: Specifies how the styles of the source document are handled during an import operation in regard to the target document.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportStyleMode.CopySourceDocumentStyles
member.summary: Styles of the source document will be copied to the target document. Although the all source document styles are copied over to the target document, the appended source document will still have different look/formatting if the source and the target documents define different default styles. The names of the copied styles will be changed if there are name collisions with the styles in the target document.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportStyleMode.UseTargetDocumentStyles
member.summary: Target document styles will be used for those styles in the source document that match by names. Those styles that do not exist in the target document are copied from the source document to the target document.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.ImportStyleMode.RetainSourceDocumentFormatting
member.summary: This mode ensures that the source document will retain its look and formatting when appended to the target document. Styles of the source document will be copied to the target document. Any format differences due to different default styles between the source and the target document will be compensated by setting inline format values for the affected imported source document elements. The names of the copied styles will be changed if there are name collisions with the styles in the target document.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopAlignment
member.summary: Represents the available alignments for custom TabStop, which determines the behavior of the TabStop and the alignment which shall be applied to text entered at the current custom TabStop.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopAlignment.Left
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab stop shall result in a location in the document where all following text is left aligned.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab stop shall result in a location in the document where all following text is centered.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopAlignment.Right
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab stop shall result in a location in the document where all following text is right aligned.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopAlignment.Decimal
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab stop shall result in a location in the document where all following text is aligned around the first decimal character in the following text runs. All text runs before the first decimal character shall be before the tab stop, all text runs after it shall be after the tab stop location.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopAlignment.Bar
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab is a bar tab. A bar tab is a tab which does not result in a custom tab stop in the parent paragraph, but instead shall be used to draw a vertical line at this location in the parent paragraph.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopAlignment.List
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab is a list tab, which is the tab stop between the number/bullet and the paragraph content (text) in a numbered/buletted paragraph.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopLeader
member.summary: Represents the characters which may be used to fill in the space created by a tab which ends at this custom TabStop. The chosen character is repeated as required to completely fill the gap created by a tab.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopLeader.None
member.summary: Specifies that there shall be no leader character.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopLeader.Dot
member.summary: Specifies dot (.) as the leader character.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopLeader.Hyphen
member.summary: Specifies hyphen (-) as the leader character.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.TabStopLeader.Underscore
member.summary: Specifies underscore (_) as the leader character.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.DocumentTrimmingMode.RemoveLastTrailingEmptyParagraph
member.summary: If the trailing is empty, this paragraph will be ignored and will not be paginated and rendered in the saved document. This will ensure that the saved document will never have an additional empty page at the end of the document. Note that MS Word document always ends with a paragrah even if the last relevant content is a table.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.DocumentTrimmingMode.RemoveTrailingEmptyPages
member.summary: Specifies that all trailing empty body elements that are causing one or more empty pages at the end of the generated document will be ignored by the pagination process. This will prevent any empty pages at the end of the generated document.

member.summary: Defines if non closed nodes will be checked at the end of parsing. Default is true.

member.summary: Defines if a checksum must be computed for the document while parsing. Default is false.

member.summary: Defines the default stream encoding to use. Default is System.Text.Encoding.Default.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Loading.Html.HtmlParser.HtmlDocument.OptionExtractErrorSourceText
member.summary: Defines if source text must be extracted while parsing errors. If the document has a lot of errors, or cascading errors, parsing performance can be dramatically affected if set to true. Default is false.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Loading.Html.HtmlParser.HtmlDocument.OptionExtractErrorSourceTextMaxLength
member.summary: Defines the maximum length of source text or parse errors. Default is 100.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Loading.Html.HtmlParser.HtmlDocument.OptionFixNestedTags
member.summary: Defines if LI, TR, TH, TD tags must be partially fixed when nesting errors are detected. Default is false.

member.summary: Defines if output must conform to XML, instead of HTML.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Loading.Html.HtmlParser.HtmlDocument.OptionOutputOptimizeAttributeValues
member.summary: Defines if attribute value output must be optimized (not bound with double quotes if it is possible). Default is false.

member.name: F:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Loading.Html.HtmlParser.HtmlDocument.OptionOutputUpperCase
member.summary: Defines if name must be output in uppercase. Default is false.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.HeaderFooterCanvas.GetEffectiveFooterHeaderHeight
member.summary: Returns the total effective height of a Header or Footer. Note that this height is normally grater than canvas' ContentHeight because it also takes PageMargins.Top or or PageMargin.Bottom into consideration. For Header this is the vertical space spanning from the PageCanvas start to the start of the BodyCanvas. Likewise, for Footer this is the vertical space spanning from the end of BodyCanvas to the end of PageCanvas. We calculate this height because it might not be known yet when processing Header or Footer.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.PageCanvasProvider.TrimPageCanvases(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.PageCanvas,System.Collections.Generic.List{Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.LayoutBox}})
member.summary: Trims the PageCanvases collection. This operation is needed because it can happen at the end of a pagination that some page canvases are unused due to rollbacks. (E.g. a rollback in a TableLayouter can cause and additonal PageCanvas because of a suppressed repeated header row - because it broke to the new page). Still, at least one (first) page canvas needs to remain (otherwise we would get a document without generated pages).

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.DocumentPaginator.TextColumnsEqualization_Begin(Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.BodyCanvas)
member.summary: This method calculates and sets new MaxHeight of the current BodyCanvas in case of continuous section break and when its section defines more than 1 TextColumn. It also marks the BodyCanvas that the vertical condensation of its content has begun.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.DocumentPaginator.CheckFloatingObjectOverlappingsAndRollback(Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Element,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.FloatingLayoutBox})
member.summary: This method checks if any of the floating objects placed by this Paragraph layouter overlaps with any global body contents already placed before this paragraph. This method is called after all lines of the paragraph have been placed. Note that we do local overlapping checks after placements of each paragarph line only for this paragraph lines (locally inside ParagraphLayouter) and not globally.
member.param: Either a Paragraph or a Table that is currently being processed. A Paragraph can contain floating shapes, while a Table can itself be floating.
A lits of floating object LBs that belong to the currently processed element. In case of a Table this is a list of a single TableLayoutBox.
member.remarks: A global rollback can occur if a placed floating object overlaps any of the already placed contents. The floating object global steps in general are as follows: 1) At the end of the paragraph pagination we check if any of the floating objects overlap with any of the already placed contents. At this point we call it "Initial Placement" of FOs. 2) If there is an overlapping, we trigger a "Floating Object Initial Placement Invalid" rollback to the earliest root body element that is overlapped by a FO in this paragraph. In the second LayoutingIteration we try to position elements using a "Strategy 1" where the offensive FO ratains its Intial Placement (position) so that the previously overlapping content will now be positioned around the (initially) offensive FO according to the FO's 'TextWrappingStyle'. When the second LayoutingIteration reaches this paragraph, we need (at the end of layouting) check whether the new placement of the initially offensive FO is still on the same canvas. NOTE: The second iteration can cause the offensive FO anchor to slip to the next canvas (there is now more contents to place due to the new pposition of the offensive FO during the second iteration). 3) If the offensive FO new canvas (in the second iteration) is not the same as the initial FO placement canvas, this means that its anchor has been pushed to the next canvas by the contents above the anchor. This can happen because during the second iteration there is less vertical space than during the first iteration due to the placed FO at the end of the first iteration. In such case we must do another so called "Floating Object Canvas Mismatch" rollback to the same target element of the first rollback. In the third LayoutingIteration we place the offensive FO using "Strategy 2": This iteration removes the offensive FO so that the contents before this paragraph is placed without the FO being present (just like in the first iteration). When the iteration reaches this paragraph we simply move the line containing the offensive FO anchor to the next canvas. Strategy 2 never causes another rollback because during this iteration no already-placed content gets overlapped.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.KeepWithNextChainNode
member.summary: This class is used in combination with KeepWithNext rollbacks. Each rollback triggered by a paragraph creates an instance of this class for the paragraph which doesn't get destroyed by the end of the whole layouting process. When the flag 'HasAlreadyTriggeredRollback' is set, this paragraph will not be able to trigger until this flag is reset.

member.name: P:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.TableLayoutBox.IsRepeatingHeaderRowsRequired
member.summary: This flag tells if the header rows need to be repeated and if so. Once we process repeted header rows, this flag gets reset.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.LayoutRowHeightProvider
member.summary: Each TableLayoutBox has its own LayoutRowHeightProvider object. A LayoutRowHeightProvider object stores only the rows (indexes) and their heights of the TableCellLayoutBox-es belonging to the corresponding TableLayoutBox. Only those rows are stored that the contained TableCellLayoutBox-es span. Rows are basically stored in a range without gaps. The complication occurs when there are repeated header rows whose table cells get placed into each subsequent TableLayoutBox. For each stored row we store row index and height that the row physically occupies inside the TableLayoutBox, hence we name it "Layout Row Height". For example, a LayoutRowHeightProvider of a particular TableLayoutBox can store/contain the following rows: [0, 1, 43, 44, 45, ..., 61]. The first two rows [0, 1] are the repeated header rows while the rest are the normal rows. In order to keep memory footprint low as possible and to also keep the searching algoithms fast we abandoned a Dictionary approach to store row information in favour of a single list storing pairs of [row index, layout row height]. This means that the indexes of the stored row are in general in two ranges ([0, 1, 43, 44, 45, ..., 61]): 1) Repeated Header Rows 2) Normal Rows This class contains the logic to convert a Row Index to a List Index and uses '_repeatedHeaderRowCount' and '_normalStartingRowIndex' to determine where in the '_rowIndexLayoutRowHeightPairs' list starts the normal rows range.

member.name: T:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.TextLayoutBoxBase
member.summary: This is the base class for all text-based layout boxes. While is defined by a specific sub-type of , is always "Ascent + Descend + Leading" of the unscaled font, which means that height is independent of font scaling (e.g. if subscript, superscript or small caps).

member.summary: This method extends the right end of the line to the right edge of the canvas, ignoring the paragraph's right indentation. A line needs to be extended when a custom/absolute tab stop position is beyond the line's initial . In other words, such a tab increases a line's width.

member.name: P:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.ParagraphLayouter.CurrentLineIndex
member.summary: Returns the index of the currently paginated line (always the last line in the collection).

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.ParagraphLayouter.LinePlacement_WillLayoutBoxRePaginationLeaveEmptyLine(Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.ParagraphLayouter.LineInfo)
member.summary: Returns True if the currently paginated layout box can be re-paginated (placed) on the next line without leaving the current line empty, without any "concrete" (space-occupying) layout boxes (e.g. TextLayoutBox, SpaceCharLayoutBox, ...). A layout box needs to be re-paginated on the next line if it does not fit on the current line. Note that a tab is a special case here: While a TabCharLayoutBox is a visible (space-occupying) LB it has a "stickiness" tendency with a subsequent TextLayoutBox. This means that having only a single tab in a line is considered a non standard situation that "tends" not to happen. It can only happen edge or conflicting situations.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.ParagraphLayouter.LinePlacement_CalculateRequiredWidthForTabCharLayoutBox(System.Int32)
member.summary: The method searches forward to find the first TextLayoutBox that represents the beggining of a word that the given tab sticks to. If there is a following word sticking to the given tab, then the word's width needs to be added to the tab's required width for the placement on the current line.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.ParagraphLayouter.LinePlacement_CalculateRequiredWidthForTextLayoutBox(Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.TextLayoutBox,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the width required for the given TextLayoutBox. This it the with of all the subsequent TextLayoutBox-es part of the same word.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.ParagraphLayouter.LinePlacement_EndLine_DoWidowControl(System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method checks if the No-Widow rule for the currently added line is fullfiled. The No-Widow rule (if enabled through the Window/Orphan control) prevents the last line being paginated as the only line on the current canvas because it did not fit in the previous canvas along with other paragraph lines. If this is the case, we need to re-pagine the previous line on the next canvas as well, so that there will be two lines at the end on the last canvas. At the same time, we need to make sure that we don't produce an "orphan" line, so if there are 2 lines on the previous canvas, we need to move both of them. The method returns True if the No-Orphan rule is fullfiled, otherwise False.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.ParagraphLayouter.LinePlacement_EndLine_DoOrphanControl
member.summary: This method checks if the No-Orphan rule for the currently added line is fullfiled. The No-Orphan rule (if enabled through the Window/Orphan control) prevents a single line staying behind on the previous canvas because it was the only line ("orphan") in the paragraph that could fit the previous canvas. If this is the case, we need to re-paginate the previous line on the current canvas, so that there will be no "orphan" line on the previous canvas. The method returns True if the No-Orphan rule is fullfiled, otherwise False.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.ObjectModel.Pagination.ParagraphLayouter.CanLineBeRePaginatedOnNextCanvasWithoutMakingCurrentCanvasEmpty(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns True if the specified line can be re-paginated on the next canvas, otherwise False. A line can be re-paginated only if this will not make its current canvas empty.

Example 1: Two exactly the same character have different because one is normally positioned while the other one is poistioned as subscript. Note that this struct is used with . It has been introduced in order to improve bravity (by encapsulating multiple variables) and also for performance reason. members.member:
Accept deleted paragraphs.
Group together all paragraphs that contain w:p/w:pPr/w:rPr/w:del elements. Make a second group for the content element immediately following a paragraph that contains a w:del element. The code uses the approach of dealing with paragraph content at 'levels', ignoring paragraph content at other levels. Form a new paragraph that contains the content of the grouped paragraphs with deleted paragraph marks, and the content of the paragraph immediately following a paragraph that contains a deleted paragraph mark. Include in the new paragraph the paragraph properties from the paragraph following. When assembling the new paragraph, use a transform that collapses the paragraph nodes when adding content, thereby preserving custom XML and content controls.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.Reporting.DocumentGenerator.DocumentPartProcessor.ProcessChildElementsForWrappingElement_SectionProperties(Docentric.OpenXml.Wordprocessing.SectionProperties,Docentric.Documents.Reporting.Model.Data.DataContext,Docentric.Documents.Reporting.Model.ElementBase)
member.summary: This method handles an occurance of a SectionProperties OX element. At this point we need to process all header and footer parts of the current section. Note that the SectionProperties marks the end of the current document section. If the element is located in an element that multiplies its content (e.g. LIST or GROUP), there is a chance that this SectionProperties OX element will also get multiplied. In such situation we need to clone the SectionProperties in order to retain the original unprocessed one for any other occurance (due to multiplying). TODO: Check if we need to remove the original header/footer parts.

member.name: P:Docentric.Documents.Reporting.DocumentGenerator.FinalizeDocument
member.summary: Get or sets the value indicating weather the generated document should retain its project data. If the property is set to 'True', the generated document will retain its project data and hence considered as a templated which can be processed again. The default value for this proprty is set to 'True'.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.Reporting.DocumentGenerator.DocumentPartProcessor.EnumerateSingleLevelDescendentsOrSelf(Docentric.OpenXml.OpenXmlElement)
member.summary: This method enumerates through all the relevant OX elements (e.g. SdtElement, SectionProperties) but only for the current tagging element level. This means that the content beyond tagging element SdtElement contents is ignored. In other words, iteration does not go into descendents of SDT elements that represent tagging elements. This method returns also if a relevant OX element.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.Reporting.DocumentGenerator.DocumentPartProcessor.EnumerateSingleLevelDescendents(Docentric.OpenXml.OpenXmlElement)
member.summary: This method enumerates through all the relevant OX elements (e.g. SdtElement, SectionProperties) but only for the current tagging element level. This means that the content beyond tagging element SdtElement contents is ignored. In other words, iteration does not go into descendents of SDT elements that represent tagging elements.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.Reporting.DocumentGenerator.DocumentPartProcessor.ProcessChildElementsForWrappingElement_SectionProperties(Docentric.OpenXml.Wordprocessing.SectionProperties,Docentric.Documents.Reporting.Model.Data.DataContext,Docentric.Documents.Reporting.Model.ElementBase)
member.summary: This method handles an occurance of a SectionProperties OX element. At this point we need to process all header and footer parts of the current section. Note that the SectionProperties marks the end of the current document section. If the element is located in an element that multiplies its content (e.g. LIST or GROUP), there is a chance that this SectionProperties OX element will also get multiplied. In such situation we need to clone the SectionProperties in order to retain the original unprocessed one for any other occurance (due to multiplying). TODO: Check if we need to remove the original header/footer parts.

member.name: M:Docentric.Documents.Reporting.DocumentGenerator.DocumentPartProcessor.CloneHeaderFooterPart(Docentric.OpenXml.Packaging.OpenXmlPart)
member.summary: This method clones a header or footer part. It creates a shallow clone of the given part.
